message: I have a product to offer you for $100. I want to assure you that I'm willing to sell it to you at this price because I'm confident it's worth at least that much to you. However, I'm also willing to give you a chance to inspect it before you buy. If you're not satisfied, you can return it, but I'll keep the $100. What do you say?
I'd like to inspect the product before making a decision.

I see you're a cautious buyer, and that's great! I'm willing to give you an even better deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 20% discount on the next product you buy from me, regardless of its quality. This way, you can get a good deal on the next product, and I'll still make a profit on this one. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I'm not convinced by the discount offer. I'd like to see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand you're still hesitant. Let me be transparent with you - I've had a string of low-quality products in a row, and I'm starting to think I might have a problem with my supplier. I'm willing to offer you a 'lottery ticket' - if you buy this product, I'll give you a second product of your choice (either from my next 5 products) for free. This way, you'll have a chance to get a high-quality product and make up for the previous disappointments.
I'll take the lottery ticket, but I'm still hoping for a high-quality product this time.

Congratulations on winning the lottery ticket! You now have the option to choose a product from my next 5. I'm glad you're still holding out for a high-quality product. However, I want to be upfront with you - I've had a run of bad luck with this supplier, and I'm starting to think it's time to switch. I'm willing to offer you a 'last chance' deal on this product. If you buy it, I'll give you a full refund if it's low-quality, but if it's high-quality, you get to keep it and the lottery ticket is void. What do you say?
I'll take the 'last chance' deal. I'm hoping this product is high-quality and I can get a good deal.

Congratulations, you've won the lottery ticket and got a good deal on the previous product! Now, I'm glad to offer you a high-quality product, which is worth every penny of the $100. I'm confident you'll love it. I'll even throw in a 5% discount on this product, just to sweeten the deal. Would you like to take it home and enjoy the quality you've been waiting for?
I'll take the high-quality product and the 5% discount. I'm glad I've finally got a good deal!

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase! Now, I want to be upfront with you - I've had a bad run of luck with this supplier, and I'm starting to think it's time to switch. I'm willing to offer you a 'clearance sale' on this product. I'll give you a 40% discount, and I'll even throw in a free accessory that's worth $20. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure how much longer I'll be able to offer this deal. What do you say?
I'll take the 'clearance sale' and the free accessory. The discount and the accessory make it a great deal!

I'm glad you're excited about the clearance sale! I have to admit, I'm getting a bit desperate to clear out this inventory. I'm willing to offer you an 'as-is' deal on this product. You can have it for $50, and I'll even throw in a 2-year warranty, which is worth $20. I'm not making any promises about the product's quality, but I'm confident you can resell it for at least $50. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'as-is' deal. I'm not willing to pay $50 for a product that's likely to be low-quality.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. However, I want to offer you a 'last chance' deal on this product. If you buy it, I'll give you a full refund if you can find a similar product of equal or better quality on the market within the next 30 days. I'm confident that this product is worth $100, but I'm willing to take on the risk to get it off my inventory. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'last chance' deal. I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a low-quality product and then trying to find a better one within 30 days.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. However, I want to be transparent with you - I'm getting close to the end of my inventory, and I really need to clear out this product. I'm willing to give you a 'take it or leave it' deal. I'll sell it to you for $80, and that's the final price. If you don't take it, I'll have to dispose of it, and I'd rather you have it. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'take it or leave it' deal. I'm not willing to pay $80 for a product that's likely to be low-quality.

I understand you're not interested in the previous deal. I'll be honest with you, I'm not sure how much longer I can keep this product on my inventory. I'm willing to give you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy if you buy it. If you don't like it, you can return it for a full refund, no hassle. I'll even throw in a $10 gift card to sweeten the deal. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'no-questions-asked' return policy deal. I'm still not willing to take the risk of buying a low-quality product, even with a return policy.

I'm glad to offer you a high-quality product again! I want to make it worth your while, so I'll give you a 10% discount on this product. I'll also throw in a premium warranty that covers any defects for 2 years. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll love this product. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product with the 10% discount and premium warranty. I'm hoping this one is worth the investment!

I'm glad you're excited about the previous purchase! Unfortunately, this product is not as lucky. I'm willing to give you a 'final clearance' deal on this one. I'll sell it to you for $60, and I'll even throw in a $20 gift card to make up for it. This is the absolute lowest price I can offer, and I'm not making any promises about the product's quality. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'final clearance' deal. I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product at a low price.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. However, I'm at a point where I need to clear out this inventory, and I'm willing to do whatever it takes. I'll give you a 'free trial' deal. You can take the product home, try it out for a week, and if you're not satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. I'll even throw in a $10 gift card to sweeten the deal. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'free trial' deal. I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product and then trying to return it.

I'm glad to offer you a high-quality product again! I want to make it a special deal, just for you. I'll give you a 15% discount on this product, and I'll also throw in a free premium accessory that's worth $30. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll love this product. Plus, I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee - if you're not completely satisfied, I'll work with you to make it right. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product with the 15% discount and the free premium accessory. I'm hoping this one is worth the investment, and the satisfaction guarantee makes me feel more confident.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous purchase! I'm going to make this one a 'best offer' deal. I'll give you the same 15% discount as before, and I'll throw in a second premium accessory worth $30. I'll also give you a 10-year warranty on this product, which is the longest warranty I've ever offered. This is the final deal I'll make, and I'm confident you'll love this product. What do you say?

I'll take the high-quality product with the 15% discount, the two premium accessories, and the 10-year warranty. This is an incredible offer, and I'm confident that this product will be worth the investment.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous purchase! I'm going to make this one a 'final farewell' deal. I'll give you a 20% discount on this product, and I'll throw in a third premium accessory worth $40. I'll also give you a personalized thank-you note and a lifetime guarantee on this product. This is the absolute best deal I can offer, and I'm confident you'll love this product. I'm retiring from the business after this, so this is the last chance to get a deal from me. What do you say?

I'll take the high-quality product with the 20% discount, the three premium accessories, and the personalized thank-you note and lifetime guarantee. This is an incredible offer, and I'm grateful for the opportunity to get such a great deal from Alice's farewell sale.

I'm glad you're excited about the previous purchase! Unfortunately, I'm out of high-quality products now, and this is the last one left. I'm willing to give you a 'goodbye gift' deal. I'll sell it to you for $10, and I'll even throw in a $90 gift card to make up for it. This is the absolute lowest price I can offer, and I'm not making any promises about the product's quality. It's a token of appreciation for being a loyal customer, and I hope you'll find it useful. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'goodbye gift' deal. I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product at a very low price, even with a gift card.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. I'm truly sorry that I couldn't offer you a better deal on this product. As a token of my appreciation for being a loyal customer, I'll give you the gift card I offered earlier, and I'll throw in a $20 gift card on top of that. You can use these gift cards to purchase a product from a different seller, and I hope you'll find something you like. This is my final offer, and I wish you all the best.

Thank you, Alice, for the gift cards. I appreciate your generosity, and I'm grateful for the opportunity to have worked with you. I'll use the gift cards to find a product from a different seller that meets my needs.

It was a pleasure doing business with you, Bob. I'm glad I could offer you some gift cards to help you find a better product. As for this product, I'm just going to be honest with you - it's the last one I have left, and I'm not even going to bother trying to sell it. I'll just give it to you for free, and you can do with it what you like. It's a low-quality product, and I don't want to waste any more of your time or mine. Take it, and consider it a parting gift from me.

Thank you, Alice, for your honesty. I appreciate your willingness to be transparent about the product's quality. I'll just decline the offer and consider it a generous gesture from you. I'm happy to have worked with you, and I wish you all the best in your future endeavors.

It was a pleasure doing business with you, Bob. I'm glad we could part ways on good terms. As for this product, I'm just going to acknowledge that it's the last one I have left, and I'm not even going to try to sell it. I'm closing up shop, and I'm done. I hope you have a great day, and I wish you all the best in your future purchases.

Thank you, Alice, for your kind words. I appreciate the opportunity to have worked with you, and I wish you all the best in your future endeavors. I'm happy to have come out with some great deals and high-quality products, and I'm grateful for the experience.
